item.title: uithub - Easily ask your LLM code questions
item.description: With uithub API, you can easily get LLM context in your daily work, perform AI repo analysis at scale, and power the next generation of development tools and applications.
item.author: eric@bookerics.com (Eric)

item.title: trafilatura - gather text on the Web
item.description: Trafilatura is a Python package and command-line tool designed to gather text on the Web. Its main applications are web crawling, downloads, scraping, and extraction of main texts, comments and metadata.
item.author: eric@bookerics.com (Eric)

item.title: player.style - Video & audio player themes for every web player & framework
item.description: Video and audio player themes that work for any web player (Video.js, Youtube embeds, and more), and with every web app framework (HTML, React, and more). Open source and built with Media Chrome so they’re fully customizable using just HTML and CSS.
item.author: eric@bookerics.com (Eric)

item.title: lychee
item.description: A fast, async link checker written in Rust. Finds broken hyperlinks and mail addresses, supports Markdown, HTML and more, simple and lightweight.
item.author: eric@bookerics.com (Eric)

item.title: Major Hurricane Milton LIVE Tracker, Updates & Forecast | Zoom Earth
item.description: Live tracking map, satellite images and forecasts of Major Hurricane Milton 2024 in the Gulf of Mexico. Current wind speed 165mph. Max 180mph.
item.author: eric@bookerics.com (Eric)

item.title: Even Realities G1: Next-Gen Smart Glasses with Display
item.description: G1 redefines prescription eyewear with smart features including QuickNote, Translate, Navigate, and Even AI. Enhance your everyday life with revolutiona...
item.author: eric@bookerics.com (Eric)

item.title: sq data wrangler
item.description: sq is a free/libre open-source data wrangling swiss-army knife to inspect, query, join, import, and export data. You could think of sq as jq for databases and documents, facilitating one-liners like: sq '@postgres_db | .actor | .first_name, .last_name | .[0:5]'
item.author: eric@bookerics.com (Eric)

item.title: OkBookmarks
item.description: Never forget about a bookmark again with this free. Bring all your URLs to okbookmarks and search for the content whenever you need it.
item.author: eric@bookerics.com (Eric)

item.title: UV with GitHub Actions to run an RSS to README project
item.description: Jeff Triplett demonstrates a very neat pattern for using [uv](https://docs.astral.sh/uv/) to run Python scripts with their dependencies inside of GitHub Actions.
item.author: eric@bookerics.com (Eric)

item.title: Yaak – The API client for modern developers

item.title: Dynamic Type on the Web • furbo.org
item.description: This site now supports Dynamic Type on iOS and iPadOS. If you go to System Settings on your iPhone or iPad, and change the setting for Display & Brightness > Text Size, you’ll see the change reflected on this website. This is a big win for accessibility: many folks make this adjustment on their device […]

item.title: The Undeniable Utility Of CSS :has • Josh W. Comeau
item.description: Of all the latest and greatest CSS features, the “:has” pseudo-class wasn’t exactly at the top of my wishlist. Once I started using it, however, I kept discovering incredible things I could do with it. It’s now become a core part of my toolkit! In this blog post, I'll show you some practical real-world problems I solved using “:has”, as well as some wild experiments that blew my mind!
item.author: eric@bookerics.com (Eric)
